quotes.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Excellence is not an act, but a habit.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Happiness comes from within. Do not seek it without.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Know thyself.
quotes.author: Temple of Apollo at Delphi

quotes.text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Man is condemned to be free.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The present moment is all we have.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold; happiness dwells in the soul.
quotes.author: Democritus

quotes.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: What you are is what you have been. What you'll be is what you do now.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Everything flows.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: One cannot step twice in the same river.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: The obstacle is the path.
quotes.author: Zen Proverb

quotes.text: Virtue is nothing else than right reason.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.text: The price of greatness is responsibility.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: The only Zen you find on the tops of mountains is the Zen you bring up there.
quotes.author: Robert M. Pirsig

quotes.text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.text: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
quotes.author: Pericles

quotes.text: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: The highest good is like water.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: To be great is to be misunderstood.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The flame that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: What we think, we become.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu
